intro: Gymnosporia gracilipes subsp. gracilipes, commonly known as the slender-stemmed gymnosporia, is a shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its slender, often spiny stems and small, elliptical leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers followed by woody, three-lobed fruits that contain seeds. It is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky soils. Due to its unique morphology and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and ecologists studying plant adaptations in dry regions.
